tn.text: "at the times that I haven chosen"

tn.ref: the food of my offerings made by fire to produce
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the food offerings that you will burn on the altar produce" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"a smell I enjoy"
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
This can be stated in active form. "the burnt offering" or "the offering you have burned by fire on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. "which you have mixed with" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"A tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

fourth of a hin** - "One-fourth" means one part out of four equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "a liter" or "one-fourth of a hin (which is almost 1 liter)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
"pressed oil" or "pure olive oil." This refers to oil that has been pressed out of olives.

tn.ref: that was commanded at Mount Sinai
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Yahweh commanded at Mount Sinai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you burned on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

fourth of a hin** - "One-fourth" means one part out of four equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "a liter" or "one-fourth of a hin (which is almost 1 liter)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tn.ref: You must pour out in the holy place a drink offering of strong drink to Yahweh
tn.text: This sentence describes the drink offering that is to accompany the lamb. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "It must be a drink offering of strong drink and you must pour it out in the holy place to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "like the one you offered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

"Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Many offerings had a drink offering that was required to be offered with them. The full meaning of the can be made clear. AT: "the drink offering that accompanies it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

"A tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you burned on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Half" means one part out of two equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "two liters" or "half a hin (which is two liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

"One third of a hin." "A third" means one part out of three equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "1.2 liters" or "One and one-fifth liters" or "half a hin (which is 1.2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

fourth of a hin** - "One-fourth" means one part out of four equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "a liter" or "one-fourth of a hin (which is almost 1 liter)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tn.ref: One male goat as a sin offering to Yahweh must be offered
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must offer one male goat to Yahweh as a sin offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month ... the fifteenth day of this month
tn.text: "the 1st month, on the 14th day of the month ... the 15th day of this month." This refers to the first month of the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"you must celebrate Yahweh's Passover"

tn.ref: a feast is to be held
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. "you must have a feast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: bread without yeast must be eaten
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. "you must eat bread without yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the 1st day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: there must be a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "you must gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: you must offer a sacrifice made by fire, a burnt offering
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must burn an offering on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The words "of an ephah of fine flour" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters of fine flour" or "two tenths of an ephah of fine flour (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

"A tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
The word "atonement" may be expressed as a verb. AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which Yahweh requires each morning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "As I, Yahweh, have described here" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the food of the offering made by fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must burn the food offering on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"as a sweet aroma for Yahweh"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must offer it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: have a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"the day of the firstfruits, that is the day." This refers to the day during the Festival of Weeks when they offer the grain offering to Yahweh.

tn.ref: have a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah of fine flour" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters of fine flour" or "two tenths of an ephah of fine flour (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

"A tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "fine flour which you mix with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This refers to the drink offerings that are required to accompany each of the animals when they are sacrificed. AT: "the drink offerings that are offered with them" or "the drink offerings that accompany them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_possession]])
